recipeIngredient: Leftover baked macaroni and cheese, refrigerated for at least overnight
Oil for deep frying, preheated to 375 degrees

recipeInstructions.text: Cut refrigerated macaroni and cheese into slices or bite size pieces.

Season the flour with salt, pepper and cayenne. Dredge each piece through the flour and gently tap off excess. Dip in the egg wash and then coat with the bread crumbs. Allow them to rest for 5 minutes so the crust can set. Very carefully drop into the oil and fry until golden brown. Remove to a baking sheet fitted with a rack and rest for 2 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: This just transformed my delicious (but huge) macaroni and cheese into a three day affair. Delicious and simple.
I wish I could rate it higher.  I have made it several times over the past year and it turns out perfect every time.  My family and friends love it!

We have tried a number of fried mac and cheese recipes over the years and none of them were worth eating... until this one. We didn't have the crumbs so we double dipped in the flour and egg wash. They were crispy, golden and not the least bit greasy. Can't wait to have them again!!

Fives stars without a second thought. Must confess to substituting crushed Rice Chex for the panko bread crumbs,  So simple and delicious. Better than the mac and cheese main course from last night. Hooray for Leftovers!
Fun way to treat leftover macaroni. Did this in the pan with bacon grease, and it was very flavoful.
So yummy!! Reheating in the microwave is not good, they are soggy.  I reheated our by frying them for about 30 seconds and they were as crispy as the day I made them.

I tried making these after I had about a million pounds of leftover macaroni and cheese. While the recipe wasn't too difficult to follow, these came out just wayyyy too greasy for me. I could only eat a couple of them before my stomach just felt totally gross. I think next time I would just pan fry them with cooking spray instead of trying to fry-fry them.

I love this recipe! My family made Macaroni and cheese It is my favorite food but dont' put that much salt but if you love salt go ahead and put the salt in the recipe!.
- Chief Queen
yum

What's not to love?  I first had fried Mac and Cheese at a bowling alley in Louisville, and was in love!  This recipe can also be made similarly, but baked.  Just make as directed, spray a cookie sheet with cooking spray, place balls on sheet and coat generously with cooking spray.  Put in a 350-375 degree oven for 20 minutes, or until golden.  They don't quite compare to the fried version, but you may find reason to enjoy it more often with a little less guilt ;)

We love this recipe but always feel it lacks seasoning.  This time I tried adding the cayenne pepper to the mac n' cheese while baking it, along with a little cumin and salt and pepper.  Then made the recipe as shown.  Delicious.  We served it with sour cream for dipping.

My goodness...  What can I say?  I had never heard of frying left-over mac and cheese, so I just had to try it.  It is amazing!  If you've never made this recipe you should really give a shot.  Very quick and easy, not to mention delicious!
truly awesome, now find something equally awesome to dip it in!! ...try drawn butter with garlic and tabasco
my son does this with leftover lasagna....amazing!!!!
What a great way to make leftovers into something different!  Everyone loved this.
Thank you Alton for another great, creative recipe!

Now I have yet to try this with his baked macaroni and cheese recipe but I used it with mine.  I hadn't added enough seasoning in mine but despite my first attempt folly I found this to have extraordinary potential for something so simple.  Absolutely fantastic with leftovers and I'm debating on making another batch of macaroni and cheese so I can try again.  Really 5 star stuff since it's very simple and very open to any kind of personal adjustments to more fit the taste of you and your family.
this was great to have a a sandwich in the go in the morning

We loved this idea... Didn't follow recipe exactly though. We don't care for "spicy" so... We just left the spices out. Son doesn't like bread crumbs so... we just used flour for final coating. I've always made too much mac & cheese - Now I know what to do with the left-overs!
Thanks Alton - Just Love Your Show!
We make extra mac and cheese just so we have enough to make this the next day.  My whole family loves it!

Alton Brown is my hero, and after you try deep fried mac and cheese, he will be yours too! This recipe is so easy, and absolutely delicious.

My tip: Cut the mac and cheese into rectangular slabs (rather than cubes). This lets you reheat left overs in the toaster, keeping the breading golden brown and delicious!
just make sure the oil is the right temp, or it can get too greasy.
It's good
i think that it was very easy and tasty very good but bad for you
I didn't particularly like the Mac and Cheese the second day but this dish gave the meal new life.
I have made this several times; I make the baked version just so I can fry it the next day. Super yummy!

Good example of setting up moist foods for deep frying (flour - egg wash - panko).

Warms up mac and cheese nicely, crust adds nice flavor. If using AB's stove top recipe, the pepper-cayenne seasoning compliments it nicely.
Personally, I thought that cooking it a second time intensified the onion flavor. Although my wife and stepdaughter like to dip it in their tomato soup.
a
This was a great idea for "next day" mac and cheese.  I would not make this on a regular basis but it was a very decadent treat.
I loved this more than i liked the mac n cheese the night before!  Thank you!  very greasy, but very delicious-o!
This was great! I took it to a luncheon and everyone loved it.

the recipe at 1st seemed a little bit out of my league. I then tried it and lo and behold a yummy snack which my little niece could not stop eating.I was a close second when it came to chowing on the goodies. I would recommend this to mom's who like to cook ahead of time & pop these babies in a toaster oven or regular oven for only a few minutes t warm them up. Heck they even taste good cold.
The Next Day Mac and Cheese "toast". Was good, but not better than the original baked.  Would probably not make again for friends or family, unless asked to.

If this is heart-attack-on-a-plate, so be it.  I never would've thought of this, but it's great.  Just eat it while it's still hot from the fryer.  If it gets cold, and has to be re-heated, it's still "good", but it never gets back to "great".

OK, AB's nephew was right when he deemed this dish "Heart attack on a plate," but I think I could eat it every day.  It is that good.  I always hide a portion of the mac and cheese in order to make this next-day-meal (otherwise it all gets eaten, and I am out of luck.)  We will make this a regular weekend meal at our house.
This is simple but excellent.
My kids love this although my older one is on a bread crumb strike. Works great without it though. Nice crusty top anyway.
I never dreamed that fried mac'n cheese would be good - actually, it's GREAT.  A dash of hot sauce is yummy with it, too.
The only problem is that this meal is totally fine next day with out the "toast" ... the frying made my kids happy and they loved it .. So I would do it again ... to them it was a whole new meal.
